page.title: 03ST.REGIS BOX-FACTORY BURWELL
page.content: It was called{Tillotson's}at first. There is also another base at Ely. They have designing and printing rooms,as well as a dye-shop. { The corrugator}is as long as a foot- ball pitch.It uses{paper reels}4838m long weighing 1832 kilos.These are brought by lorry from store in disused hangers near Newmarket Heath and then moved around the site by crane.The material gets hot and when it reaches the end it is chopped and stacked.The boxes come in all sizes and colours. The firm has won many awards and produces most of the U.K.'s needs. The factory has a{Sports and Social {Club}(open to the public) with its own cricket ground.There are darts and pool teams,ladies keep-fit,dancing classes and bingo.Regular events are dances,discos and cabaret evenings. There is a summer barbeque night too.
